description: Construction of third and fourth floor  to accommodate 3 self-contained residential units (Prior Approval Application, under Part 20, Class A New Dwellinghouses on detached blocks of flats)
decision_conditions: The development permitted under this permission must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the date prior approval is granted.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (As Amended) and Condition A.2(1)(e) of Class A of Part 20 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (As Amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):

Location plan, Existing elevation, Existing section, Existing floor plans, GA 101 - Proposed floor plans, GA 102 - Proposed elevation, GA 103 - Proposed side elevation, GA 104 - Proposed side elevation, GA 105 - Proposed section, Daylight and sunlight report by Right of L:ight Consulting dated 23 September 2020,
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match those indicated in the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to occupation, the external noise levels from transport and industrial and/ or commercial sources and the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building) shall achieve internal room- and (if required) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014. Details shall then be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from transport, industrial and/or commercial noise sources, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'; and Local Variation policy 3.5 of the Ealing's draft Development Management Plan Document.

| Enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedroom adjacent to staircase, living/dining room and kitchen above/below bedroom of separate dwellings shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'; and Local Variation policy 3.5 of the Ealing's draft Development Management Plan Document.

| Prior to occupation, details of a minimum of four cycle storage spaces shall be submitted to provided in writing by the LPA. These details shall include the siting and appearance of these space and once approved, shall be retained permanently. Cycle parking shall also comply with the London Cycling Design Standards.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development and to provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.16 and 6.9 of the London Plan (2016).
| Prior to occupation, details of the siting and appearance of the refuse and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the LPA. These shall then be retained permanently..
Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing
